## The Pied Piper of Hamelin

The Pied Piper is a famous German legend. In the story, a man with a magical pipe is hired to get rid of rats in the town of Hamelin. When the town doesn't pay him, he uses his pipe to lead the town's children away, just like he did with the rats. 

Some people think the story is about hope during a plague, with the Piper saving the town by driving out the rats. The phrase "Pied Piper" now means someone who attracts people with promises, not always truthful.
